results.title: Queensland Centenary Story, 1859-1959
results.creator_credit: Dulcie Holland, Eric Thompson, Judy Campbell, Malcolm Otton and Australian Commonwealth Film Unit
results.brief_description: A brief account of the first hundred years of Queensland’s history, touching on its social life, its connection with two world wars, its industries and its agricultural and pastoral pursuits. Many sequences of historical intrest - in particular the visit of the Prince of Wales in 1921 and the Trans-Pacific flight by Sir Charles Kingsford Smith.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Dulcie Holland, Eric Thompson, Judy Campbell, Malcolm Otton and Australian Commonwealth Film Unit

results.title: La Quebecoise
results.creator_credit: Les Nirenberg, Ian McLaren and National Film Board of Canada
results.brief_description: Her image has changed. The French-Canadian woman of today is no longer the chattel of yesterday, without legal rights and with limited career opportunuites. Speaking of the struggle to bring about change, the evolving role of women in Quebec society, and the challenges still ahead are some very articulate ladies: Senator Therese Casgrain, Judge Rejane Colas, a nun, a Playboy bunny, and seveal feminists.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Les Nirenberg, Ian McLaren and National Film Board of Canada

results.title: Putting it straight: A story of crooked teeth

results.title: Punch press guarding
results.creator_credit: Kenneth Campbell and Industrial Accident Prevention Associations
results.brief_description: Shows management and employees that there is a guard to protect workers on every type of punch press and that protection is provided only when the guard is properly adjusted. The punch press has a record of producing more permanent disability injuries than any other industrial mechanical equipment. Shocking accidents are shown followed by examples of guards available and a clear statement of the foreman’s responsibility in preventing accidents.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Kenneth Campbell and Industrial Accident Prevention Associations

results.title: Public Opinion
results.brief_description: Discussed the factors which help to form public opinion including the mass media of communication, such as exhibitions, magazines, books, conversation, oratory, broadcasting, plays and films. Stresses the responsibility of each person to sift these varied sources of information, make the best decisions he can, and act upon them.
